title: Content Management
content:
Welcome to Content Store!

The Content Store is a web based service for managing capsules. Users can download the latest capsules published on the ITOM Marketplace and use Content Store to install them into the suite. Users can also use Content Store to install custom capsules. 

What's a capsule?

A capsule is a distributable, structured archive of certain artifacts bundled together with well defined metadata or manifests. The commonly bundled artifacts are Service Designs, Resource Offerings, Components, Operations Orchestration (OO) Content Packs, Auxiliary Files, and more.

Content Store

To access Content Store, assign a Cloud Management license to the tenant. From the main menu, navigate to Build > Design > Content Management. 

Content area

The content area includes the following items:

Item   Description
Select the Install icon to install a capsule.
Tiles

The capsule that's installed will appear as tiles in the content area. One tile represents one capsule with the version installed last.
The capsules get displayed by the latest installation timestamp.

If a capsule is successfully uninstalled, the tile corresponding to that capsule disappears from the content area.

Tile

The following table describes the different elements in a tile:

Item Description
Capsule logo Content provider logo.
If capsule installation is successful, this icon appears. If you hover over this area, you can see the installation timestamp.
If capsule installation or uninstallation is unsuccessful, this icon appears. If you hover over this area, you can see the reason for the failure.
Name of the capsule

Name of the capsule that's installed. 
 
Version Latest version of the capsule that's installed.
By Author or publisher of the capsule.
Installation status If capsule installation is successful, the tile shows Installed. If installation fails, the status is Install Failed. If uninstallation fails, the status is Uninstall Failed.
Description Description about the capsule.
Uninstall menu. If you select this, the Uninstall button appears. On selecting Uninstall, the Preview screen pops up.
Progress bar This appears when installation or uninstallation is in progress.

Preview

The following table describes the different elements of the Preview screen.

Item Description
Name of the capsule Name of the capsule that's selected for uninstallation.
Version Highest version of the capsule that's selected for uninstallation.
Ready to Uninstall  If the capsule is good for uninstallation, this header appears followed by a description.
Action Required  If capsule isn't fit for uninstallation, this header appears followed by a description.
Artifacts

The list of service designs, service components, resource offerings, and content packs that are part of the selected capsule.

Each artifact will have an icon before it. If an artifact has  , then it gets removed. If an artifact has  , then it won't get removed as it may affect the functionality of the capsule. The uninstallation won't proceed in this situation until the error gets resolved. If an artifact has , it won't get removed, but the uninstallation will proceed. If you hover on  , you will see what each of these icons stand for.
Footer Footer includes a count of errors and warnings, Uninstall, and Cancel. The Uninstall button will be enabled if a capsule is ready for uninstallation. If any action is required, the Uninstall button will be disabled.

Uninstallation use cases

The following are the use cases for uninstallation:

  1. If a capsule has a published service design(s) and you try to uninstall it, the Preview will show   before that particular service design and on hover you will be able to see the reason "<Service design name> is in published state." The Uninstall button will be disabled in this case.
  2. If a capsule has active deployments and you try to uninstall it, the Preview will show   before that particular service design and on hover you will be able to see the reason "Deployment found with Active Instances: <Service design name>." The Uninstall button appears disabled in this case.
  3. If any artifact has references to other artifacts outside of the capsule, during uninstallation these artifacts won't be removed. The Preview will show  before that particular artifact and on hover you will be able to see the reason or dependency detail. The Uninstall button appears enabled in this case.
  4. If no artifacts are available in a capsule and you try to uninstall that capsule, the Preview will show no artifacts. The Uninstall button appears enabled in this case.
  5. By default during uninstallation, OO content packs aren't removed. The Preview will show   before all the content packs in that particular capsule. The Uninstall button appears enabled in this case.
  6. If you have created any copy of the artifacts, the artifact copy won't be considered for uninstallation.

OOTB content packs

The following table lists the OOTB content packs. If you need to manually download these content packs, follow the order given here:

Content packs Marketplace link
oo10-base-cp

To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
oo10-cloud-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
oo-microfocus-solutions-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
oo10-virtualization-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
oo10.50-csa-integrations-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
oo-base-utility-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
oo-provider-resource-sync-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
cs-dnd-oo-integration-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
cs-google-cloud-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
cs-base-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
cs-microfocus-hcm-base-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
cs-amazon-aws-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
cs-microsoft-azure-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.
cs-vmware-vcenter-cp To download the latest version of the content pack, visit the ITOM Marketplace.

Install a capsule using Content Store

Here are the steps to follow to install a capsule using Content Store:

  1. Visit the ITOM Marketplace and select a capsule that you want to install. Check the Product Compatibility information and make sure that the selected capsule version is compatible with your solution.
  2. Download the capsule to your local file system. 
  3. Select    from the toolbar to start installing the capsule from your local file system. Once the installation starts, a tile for the respective capsule appears in the Content area and a progress bar runs on the tile till the installation completes.

If capsule installation is successful, then the capsule and its artifacts are available in the respective applications. You can now start consuming the artifacts from the Cloud Management environment.

Use a capsule or content pack

To use a capsule or content pack, refer to the capsule or content pack specific documentation that's available in the ITOM Marketplace portal.

Follow these steps to access the capsule or content pack documentation in the ITOM Marketplace portal:

  1. Log in to the ITOM Marketplace.
  2. Search for the capsule or content pack using the Search box.
  3. On the capsule or content pack download page, go to the Releases section.
  4. Expand the release (version) you are looking for.
  5. Move to Release notes. You can find the documentation link here.

Capsule certificate validation

During installation, Content Store checks for a capsule's signature status. By default, if the capsule isn't signed or if the signature isn't trusted, then the capsule installation fails. Following are the 3 types of certificate validation:

  1. ALLOW_TRUSTED (recommended): This will allow capsule installation only if the capsule has a digital certificate and the certificate is present in the Content Store Truststore (this is where capsule certificates of trustworthy sources are added and marked as trusted). This is the highest level of security as it allows you to install only trusted capsules.
  2. ALLOW_SIGNED: This will allow any capsules having a digital certificate to install irrespective of their certificate getting stored in Content Store Truststore or not.
  3. ALLOW_NOT_SIGNED: This will allow any capsule including unsigned ones without certification to continue with the installation process. It's the lowest security level.

To change the level of certificate validation for your chosen capsule, the tenant admin (user with CS_TENANT_ADMIN permission) should make a PUT REST API call: 

Parameter Description
Request name PUT
Content type application/json
Authorization <X-Auth-Token>
Request URL 
https://<host>/content-store-gateway/v1/<tenant ID>/configure
Request body 
{

    "contentSignatureLevel": "ALLOW_TRUSTED"

}

Self sign your capsule certificate

To trust your capsule's signature in the Content Store Truststore, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the master node.
  2. Use the following command to stop the Content Store backend service: 
    kubectl scale deployment itom-content-store-backend --replicas=0 -n <namespace>
  3. Place the customized certificate at:
    <config-volume>/certificate/cmp/source
  4. Start the Content Store backend service: 
    kubectl scale deployment itom-content-store-backend --replicas=1 -n <namespace>

Limitation

  • Content Store isn't integrated with the ITOM Marketplace.

Related topics

  • For more details on how to create a capsule, see Content SDK.
  • For more information on how to apply a Cloud Management license, see Cloud Management license.
  • For information about Content Store logs, see Where to find the suite logs.
